name: Royal Enfield Hunter 350
metaTitle: Royal Enfield Hunter 350 – Neo-Retro Urban Roadster | 349cc
metaDescription: Explore the Royal Enfield Hunter 350: 349cc neo-retro roadster with smooth torque, dual disc brakes & 30–34 kmpl mileage. Perfect for city rides & weekend getaways.
short_description: Royal Enfield Hunter 350 is a 349cc roadster that blends neo-retro styling with modern performance, ideal for urban commutes and casual touring.

hunter Royal Enfield 350 Royal Blue Front View
hunter Royal Enfield 350 Royal Blue Left View
hunter Royal Enfield 350 Royal Blue Right View

pros: Dual disc brakes for solid stopping power

faqs.question: Is the Hunter 350 good for beginners?
faqs.answer: Yes, its upright stance and manageable power make it beginner-friendly.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Some variants come with dual-channel ABS, others with single-channel or none.

faqs.question: Can it handle highway touring?
faqs.answer: Yes, it's capable of relaxed cruising around 90–100 km/h.

faqs.question: How often does it need servicing?
faqs.answer: Recommended service interval is every 5,000 km or 6 months.

name: Royal Enfield Bullet 350
metaTitle: Royal Enfield Bullet 350 – Iconic 346cc Cruiser | Classic Thump & 33–36 kmpl
metaDescription: Ride the legendary Bullet 350: timeless 346cc cruiser with deep thump, 33–36 kmpl mileage & unmatched heritage. Built for comfort & long-distance cruising.
short_description: Royal Enfield Bullet 350 is an iconic 346cc cruiser known for its timeless design, deep exhaust note, and comfortable long-distance riding capability.

image_urls.alt: bullet Royal Enfield 350 Royal Blue Front View
bullet Royal Enfield 350 Royal Blue Left View
bullet Royal Enfield 350 Royal Showroom View

faqs.question: Is the Bullet 350 fuel efficient?
faqs.answer: It offers around 33–36 kmpl, good for a cruiser of its size.

faqs.question: Does it support pillion riding?
faqs.answer: Yes, it has a spacious seat and comfortable pillion support.

faqs.question: Is the Bullet good for off-road riding?
faqs.answer: Not primarily, but its suspension and ground clearance allow mild off-roading.

faqs.question: Can I add accessories like backrest or windshield?
faqs.answer: Yes, it's highly customizable with official and aftermarket parts.

name: Royal Enfield Classic 350
metaTitle: Royal Enfield Classic 350 – Retro Cruiser with J-Series Engine | 30–34 kmpl
metaDescription: Classic 350 blends vintage design & modern J-series engine. Enjoy dual disc brakes, 30–34 kmpl efficiency & relaxed highway cruising in true Royal Enfield style.
short_description: Royal Enfield Classic 350 is a 349cc retro cruiser known for its vintage charm, smooth J-series engine, and balanced performance on both city and highway roads.
pros: Comfortable for daily use and touring
Dual disc brakes and good ride quality

faqs.question: Does Classic 350 come with ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, dual-channel ABS is available in most variants.

faqs.question: Is it good for touring?
faqs.answer: Yes, it performs well on highways with a comfortable seating posture.

faqs.question: How is the engine refinement?
faqs.answer: The new J-series engine is significantly more refined than older models.

faqs.question: What is the fuel tank range?
faqs.answer: With a 13L tank and 30–34 kmpl, you can expect 390–440 km per tank.

faqs.answer: It has a low seat height of 765 mm, suitable for most riders.

faqs.answer: Yes, Bluetooth is available for navigation and smartphone connectivity.

name: Hero Glamour

metaDescription: Hero Glamour delivers 125cc practicality, 50–55 kmpl fuel efficiency & reliable performance—ideal for daily city commuting on a budget.

faqs.question: Is Hero Glamour fuel efficient?
faqs.answer: Yes, it delivers around 50–55 kmpl in real-world riding.

faqs.question: Does Hero Glamour have disc brakes?
faqs.answer: Yes, it has front disc in higher variants; base variant has drum.

faqs.question: Is Hero Glamour good for long rides?
faqs.answer: It is best suited for short city commutes, not for long highway rides.

faqs.question: What is the fuel tank capacity?
faqs.answer: It has a 10-liter fuel tank.

faqs.answer: It comes with a 4-speed manual gearbox.

faqs.question: Does it offer good mileage?
faqs.answer: Yes, the BS4 Glamour is known for delivering over 50+ kmpl.

faqs.question: Is the build quality reliable?
faqs.answer: Yes, it has a solid and practical design suitable for daily use.

faqs.question: What is the real-world mileage?

faqs.answer: It's mainly for daily commutes, but occasional long rides are fine with breaks.

name: Hero Hunk
metaTitle: Hero Hunk 150 – Muscular 150cc Street Bike | 42–50 kmpl & 15.6 PS
metaDescription: Hero Hunk 150 delivers bold styling, 15.6 PS power & confident handling—a head-turner for young urban riders seeking sporty daily performance.
short_description: Hero Hunk is a muscular and stylish 150cc bike designed for those who want a sporty ride with reliable performance, comfortable handling, and a bold presence on the road.

faqs.question: Does the Hero Hunk come with ABS?
faqs.answer: No, it does not offer ABS in the current version.

faqs.question: What type of instrument console does it have?
faqs.answer: It has a combination of analog tachometer and digital speedometer.

faqs.question: Is the Hero Hunk suitable for long rides?
faqs.answer: Yes, it offers decent comfort and power for short to medium highway trips.

faqs.question: Does it support tubeless tyres?
faqs.answer: Yes, both front and rear tyres are tubeless.

name: Hero Hunk 150R
metaTitle: Hero Hunk 150R – Modern 150cc Streetfighter | Dual Disc Brakes
metaDescription: Hunk 150R upgrades with dual disc brakes, digital console & aggressive stance—built for style, safety & city-ready performance.
short_description: Hero Hunk 150R is a refreshed version of the classic Hunk, offering modern styling, better handling, and improved performance, tailored for city commuters and sporty riders.
pros: Wider rear tyre for better grip

faqs.question: What is the difference between Hunk 150R and older Hunk?
faqs.answer: The 150R features updated styling, dual disc brakes, and digital display.

faqs.question: Is there ABS on Hero Hunk 150R?
faqs.answer: No, the base 150R variant does not have ABS. ABS is available in the 150R ABS version.

faqs.question: Is the ride quality comfortable?
faqs.answer: Yes, it offers good suspension and seating comfort for daily use.

faqs.question: What type of tyres does it use?
faqs.answer: The Hunk 150R uses tubeless tyres with alloy wheels.

name: Hero Hunk 150R ABS
metaTitle: Hero Hunk 150R ABS – Safe 150cc Commuter | Front ABS & Digital Display
metaDescription: Hunk 150R ABS adds front-wheel ABS for safer braking, digital display & muscular design—confidence in daily city traffic.
short_description: Hero Hunk 150R ABS is the upgraded variant of the popular Hunk series, featuring single-channel ABS, muscular design, digital console, and commuter-friendly performance.
braking: Front Disc with ABS / Rear Disc
build_quality: Modern commuter with enhanced safety features
pros: Wider tyres ensure good road grip

faqs.question: Does the ABS variant have dual-channel ABS?
faqs.answer: No, the Hero Hunk 150R ABS has single-channel ABS for the front wheel only.

faqs.question: Is the engine same as the non-ABS version?
faqs.answer: Yes, both variants share the same 149.2cc engine with similar performance.

faqs.question: Can it be used for occasional touring?
faqs.answer: While possible, it’s more suitable for city use and short-distance travel.

faqs.question: What type of brake system does it use?
faqs.answer: It comes with front ABS disc and rear disc setup.

faqs.answer: No, the Hero Hunk DD does not have ABS, it features dual disc brakes only.

faqs.answer: No, it comes with a digital-analog combo instrument cluster.

faqs.question: Is this bike good for city traffic?
faqs.answer: Yes, it’s very well-suited for daily urban commuting.

faqs.question: Is there any difference in engine with the ABS version?
faqs.answer: No, the engine specs are the same as the ABS variant.

name: Hero Passion Xpro i3S

faqs.question: How does i3S system work?
faqs.answer: Automatically turns off engine at idle and restarts when clutch is engaged.

faqs.question: What's the difference between Xtec and i3S versions?
faqs.answer: Xtec has LED lights and Bluetooth, while i3S focuses on fuel efficiency.

faqs.question: Is it good for stop-and-go traffic?

faqs.question: How does IBS work?
faqs.answer: Integrated Braking System applies both brakes when rear brake is used.

faqs.answer: Yes, automatically stops engine at idle to save fuel.

metaDescription: Splendor+ Self adds self-start convenience to legendary efficiency—75–78 kmpl & proven durability for all riders.
short_description: The Hero Splendor+ Self brings the convenience of self-start to the legendary Splendor platform, maintaining its renowned reliability while adding modern convenience features.

image_urls.alt: HERO-SPLENDER-PLUS-SPORTS Hero Splendor Plus Sports Back View

faqs.question: Does it have kick start too?
faqs.answer: Yes, comes with both self and kick start options.

faqs.question: Is the engine different from standard Splendor?
faqs.answer: Same reliable 97.2cc engine with added self-starter.

faqs.question: What colors are available?
faqs.answer: Typically black, red, blue and silver options.

name: Hero Splendor+ XTEC
metaTitle: Splendor+ XTEC – Connected 100cc Bike | LED + Bluetooth + Alloy
metaDescription: Splendor+ XTEC modernizes the classic with LED lights, Bluetooth & digital display—smart features meet timeless reliability.
short_description: The Hero Splendor+ XTEC brings modern connected features to the legendary platform, offering Bluetooth connectivity and LED lighting while maintaining the bike's renowned efficiency.

image_urls.alt: HERO-SPLENDER-PLUS-SPORTS Hero Splendor Plus Sports Showroom View
Hero Splendor+ XTEC on showroom display with XTEC graphics and console

faqs.question: What XTEC features does it have?
faqs.answer: Bluetooth connectivity, call/SMS alerts, and trip analytics.

faqs.question: Does it have self-start?
faqs.answer: Yes, comes with self-start as standard.

faqs.question: Is it worth the premium over standard Splendor?
faqs.answer: Only if you value connected features and LED lighting.

name: Hero Thriller 160R 4V
metaTitle: Hero Thriller 160R 4V – 163cc 4-Valve Street Bike | ABS + LED
metaDescription: Thriller 160R 4V packs a 16.4 PS 4-valve engine, dual-channel ABS & LED lighting—premium performance for thrill-seeking riders.
short_description: The Hero Thriller 160R 4V is a premium street bike featuring a 4-valve engine, aggressive styling, and segment-leading features like Bluetooth connectivity and LED lighting.

faqs.question: What's special about the 4V engine?
faqs.answer: 4-valve design improves airflow for better power and efficiency.

faqs.question: Does it have traction control?
faqs.answer: No, but it has single-channel ABS.

faqs.question: Is it good for touring?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 160cc engine is capable for short tours.

name: Hero Thriller 160R 4V
metaTitle: Thriller 160R Fi ABS DD – 163cc Dual Disc Bike | Dual-Channel ABS
metaDescription: Thriller 160R Fi ABS DD offers fuel injection, dual-channel ABS & aggressive styling—safety meets sporty street performance.
description: The Hero Thriller 160R 4V is a premium street bike featuring a high-performance 4-valve engine for exhilarating performance. With its aggressive naked bike styling, full LED lighting, and digital instrument cluster, it offers modern aesthetics to match its impressive power. The refined 160cc engine delivers strong acceleration while maintaining good fuel efficiency. Features like dual-channel ABS, inverted front forks, and radial tires make it one of Hero's most advanced offerings, perfect for riders wanting performance and style.
braking_system: Front 276mm disc, Rear 220mm disc (with dual-channel ABS)

faqs.question: What does 4V mean?
faqs.answer: 4-valve technology for better airflow and performance.

faqs.question: Is this Hero's most powerful bike?
faqs.answer: One of the most powerful in Hero's conventional lineup (excluding Xpulse).

faqs.question: What's the top speed?
faqs.answer: About 120-125 km/h under ideal conditions.

faqs.question: Is it suitable for highway riding?
faqs.answer: Yes, the power and stability make it good for highways.

name: Hero Thriller 160R Fi ABS DD
metaTitle: Thriller 160R Fi ABS SD – Affordable 163cc Bike | Front ABS
metaDescription: Thriller 160R Fi ABS SD delivers 15.2 PS, front ABS & LED lights at a smart price—value-packed urban performance.
short_description: The Hero Thriller 160R Fi ABS DD is a sporty street bike with dual-disc braking, fuel injection, and aggressive styling, offering a balance of performance and safety features.

image_urls.alt: Hero Thriller 160R DD White Showroom View
Hero Thriller 160R DD Red Showroom View

faqs.question: Does the Thriller 160R DD have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, it comes with dual-channel ABS as standard.

faqs.question: What's the difference between DD and SD versions?
faqs.answer: DD has dual disc brakes while SD has single disc (front only).

faqs.question: Is it good for highway riding?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 163cc engine is capable for highway use.

name: Hero Thriller 160R Fi ABS SD
metaTitle: Hero Xoom 110 – Practical 110cc Scooter | 55–58 kmpl & 18L Storage
metaDescription: Xoom 110 scooter: 110cc ease, 55–58 kmpl & 18L under-seat storage—practical, comfortable city commuting for all.
short_description: The Hero Thriller 160R Fi ABS SD offers the same 163cc engine as the DD version but with single disc brake configuration, making it a more affordable option with core features intact.

image_urls.alt: Hero Thriller 160R Fi ABS SD on showroom display with sleek street styling

faqs.question: Does the SD version have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, but only single-channel ABS for the front wheel.

faqs.question: Is the engine different from DD version?
faqs.answer: No, same 163cc engine, only braking system differs.

faqs.question: Which version is better value?
faqs.answer: SD offers better value for budget-conscious buyers who can compromise on rear disc brake.

name: Hero Xoom 110
metaTitle: Hero Xoom 110 – Practical 110cc Scooter | 55–58 kmpl & 18L Storage
metaDescription: Xoom 110 scooter: 110cc ease, 55–58 kmpl & 18L under-seat storage—practical, comfortable city commuting for all.
short_description: The Hero Xoom 110 is a modern scooter offering convenience and efficiency with its 110cc engine, designed for comfortable city commuting with practical features.

faqs.question: Does Xoom 110 have disc brake option?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with drum brakes only.

faqs.question: What is the under-seat storage capacity?
faqs.answer: Approximately 18 liters - can fit a half-face helmet.

faqs.question: Is it good for female riders?
faqs.answer: Yes, its light weight and low seat height make it easy to handle.

name: Hero Xtreme 125R
metaTitle: Hero Xtreme 125R – Sporty 125cc Street Bike | LED + DRLs
metaDescription: Xtreme 125R combines aggressive looks, LED headlamp & 50–53 kmpl—youthful style with everyday practicality.
short_description: The Hero Xtreme 125R is a sporty 125cc motorcycle offering aggressive styling, decent performance, and good fuel efficiency for young riders.

faqs.question: Does Xtreme 125R have ABS?
faqs.answer: No, it comes with single disc brake upfront and drum at rear.

faqs.question: Is it good for college students?
faqs.answer: Yes, its sporty looks and good mileage make it ideal for students.

faqs.question: What colors are available?
faqs.answer: Typically sports red, black, and blue variants.

name: Hero Xtreme 160R 4V
metaTitle: Hero Xtreme 160R 4V – 163cc 4-Valve Bike | Bluetooth + ABS
metaDescription: Xtreme 160R 4V features 16.4 PS, single-channel ABS, Bluetooth & LED lighting—advanced tech for street riders.
short_description: The Hero Xtreme 160R 4V is a premium 160cc street bike featuring a 4-valve engine, aggressive styling, and segment-leading features for performance enthusiasts.

image_urls.alt: Right profile showing split seat and tank shrouds of Hero Xtreme 160R 4V
Rear view showing tail lamp and radial tyre of Hero Xtreme 160R 4V
Hero Xtreme 160R 4V on showroom display with aggressive streetfighter styling
Left profile showing engine casing and exhaust of Hero Xtreme 160R 4V

faqs.question: What's special about the 4V engine?
faqs.answer: 4-valve design improves airflow for better power and efficiency.

faqs.question: Does it have traction control?
faqs.answer: No, but it does have single-channel ABS.

faqs.question: Is it good for touring?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 160cc engine and comfortable ergonomics make it capable for short tours.

name: Hero Hunk 150R Xtec
metaTitle: Hero Hunk 150R Xtec – Connected 150cc Bike | LED + Bluetooth
metaDescription: Hunk 150R Xtec upgrades with LED lighting, Bluetooth console & dual disc brakes—smart, stylish urban commuting.
short_description: Hero Hunk 150R Xtec is a sporty 149cc commuter with a bold design, LED lighting, digital console, and dual disc brakes for better urban performance.
display: Fully Digital LCD Console with Bluetooth

image_urls.alt: Hero Hunk 150R XTEC on showroom display with XTEC badging and digital console

pros: Dual disc brakes for better safety
cons: Slight engine vibration at high rpm

faqs.question: Does the Hunk 150R Xtec have ABS?
faqs.answer: It features Combined Braking System (CBS), but not ABS.

faqs.question: Is Bluetooth available?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Xtec variant has Bluetooth for call and SMS alerts.

faqs.question: Is the bike good for beginners?
faqs.answer: Yes, it's lightweight and easy to handle for city commuting.

faqs.question: Can it be used for daily office rides?
faqs.answer: Absolutely, it offers good mileage and comfort for regular use.

name: KTM 125 Duke
metaTitle: KTM 125 Duke – Premium 125cc Naked Bike | TFT + ABS
metaDescription: 125 Duke: liquid-cooled 14.5 PS, full-color TFT, ABS & razor-sharp handling—the ultimate entry-level KTM streetfighter.
short_description: The KTM 125 Duke is an entry-level naked sports bike featuring aggressive styling, premium components, and sharp handling - perfect for beginners and urban riders.
cons: High seat height for short riders

faqs.question: Does the 125 Duke have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, it comes with dual-channel ABS as standard.

faqs.question: What is the fuel capacity?
faqs.answer: 13.4 liters with about 2.5L reserve.

faqs.question: Is it good for highway riding?
faqs.answer: Capable for short highway stretches but limited by engine size.

name: KTM RC 125
metaTitle: KTM RC 125 – Full-Faired 125cc Sportbike | Track-Ready Ergonomics
metaDescription: RC 125 brings full fairing, aggressive ergonomics & 14.5 PS—a miniature MotoGP machine for spirited riders and track days.
short_description: The KTM RC 125 is a full-faired sportbike derived from the Duke 125, offering aggressive racing ergonomics and track-focused handling in a 125cc package.
cons: Small engine for the sportbike chassis

faqs.question: How is RC 125 different from Duke 125?
faqs.answer: RC has full fairing, more aggressive ergonomics, and sportier handling.

faqs.question: Is it good for tall riders?
faqs.answer: The riding position is compact, better suited for average height riders.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, dual-channel ABS comes standard.

name: KTM 250 Duke
metaTitle: KTM 250 Duke – 30 PS Naked Streetfighter | Slipper Clutch + ABS
metaDescription: 250 Duke unleashes 30 PS, slipper clutch & dual-channel ABS—aggressive performance in KTM’s iconic orange streetfighter.
short_description: KTM 250 Duke is a performance-oriented 250cc naked streetfighter, blending aggressive design, premium components, and sharp handling for spirited riding.
braking: Front Disc, Rear Disc with Dual-Channel ABS

image_urls.alt: Right profile showing trellis frame and tank shrouds of KTM 250 Duke

cons: High seat height for shorter riders

faqs.question: Is the KTM 250 Duke suitable for beginners?
faqs.answer: It’s better suited for intermediate riders due to its power and aggressive nature.

faqs.question: Does it have ABS?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 250 Duke features dual-channel ABS as standard.

faqs.question: Is the slipper clutch standard?
faqs.answer: Yes, it comes with a slipper clutch for smoother downshifting.

faqs.question: What is the mileage in real-world usage?
faqs.answer: You can expect around 28–32 kmpl depending on riding style.
